People in Cairo headed en masse to Tahrir Square.
They were celebrating the victory of the protesters.
President Hosni Mubarak had stepped down.
They were also celebrating the army,...
...the forces who stayed largely neutral during the protest,...
...and in the end, promised to safeguard a peaceful transition.
Gone were the tracer bullets, instead, there were fireworks.
Some used that voice to give their thanks to God,...
...others to express their hopes for the future.
